page.title: 17LONGHOPE:HOPE'S HILL SCHOOL
page.content: Many small rural schools in Gloucestershire have closed. A small one still working in our area is {Hope's Hill School.}It was started in 1833 by the bequest of{Edward Goff 1738-1813 . He was born at Kington, Herefordshire,and walked 150 miles to London. He worked as a coal heaver and made a fortune. He was converted to Christianity and insisted that his teachers should be also. At{Longhope the school adjoins the{Zion Baptist {chapel}and the headteacher was the pastor. It was known as the{British {School.}It was taken over by the County council in the 1950s. It now has{39 pupils}and{2.2 teachers.}Most of the children come from Litte London and that side of Longhope village.
